TopicTitle: Do you spend time Alt-Tabbed out?

Articles.Content: Do you often spend time Alt-Tabbed out of the game while fuel transfers or waiting for several orbits to complete at maximum time warp etc? I mask it by browsing this forum or Reddit but it's still a little annoying.
My KSP build take about 6-8 mins to load so I tab out whilst that is happening, usually I'll load KSP halfway through an episode of something.

I have two monitors, and yes, sometimes do something on the other monitor. Though it's rarely during things like burns or timewarping, more normally it's just through getting a bit distracted but not closing the game.

Sometimes.  Usually though I do it either to take a break or to look something up I've forgotten in those cases I usually pause the game, but sometimes if it's like going to take 20 minutes to reach a node I'll use that as good time to do something else for a bit.  I probably need to reinstall KAC though so I don't overshoot my goal or have to keep checking back.
I generally play windowed, often with something else I am doing on the other screen and a browser open to the wiki(generally a tab on the science page for high/low boundary numbers).
I have this forum open a lot when I play, or I have music playing that needs changing every now and then.

I play full screen, and there are (were) often times I Alt-Tab out (check the Wiki on something, use a launch window planner, or a calculator), but I find the game doesn't like it and usually crashes. The likely reason (my guess) is because the laptop I play on has auto mode switching between the integrated graphics and higher-end Nvidia graphics card also onboard. Lately, I've taken to keeping a little 10" netbook by my side while playing KSP so I won't have to Alt-Tab out.

1 hour ago, THX1138 said:

I don't see any reason why the action groups shouldn't be completely re-configurable post-launch.

There was a great mod called Action Group Manager that allowed you to display--and modify--a vessel's action groups whenever you want... but it hasn't been updated in a long time. I like to use a consistent system of action group numbering for nearly all of my ships and stations and probes (and slightly different consistent systems for spaceplanes and fuel factories), so it's not usually an issue for me anymore, but on the rare occasion when I do need to make a modification (usually to correct for a symmetry bug in the VAB), I open up the persistent file with a text editor and make the change manually. Tedious but it gets the job done.
